meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force.
meanings.sent1: He clobbered the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent2: The boxer clobbered his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The baseball player accidentally clobbered the ball into the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The storm clobbered the coast with strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The hammer clobbered the nail into the wood with a loud bang.

meanings.definition: To defeat decisively in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: She clobbered her opponent in the chess match.
meanings.sent2: The team clobbered their rivals in the soccer game.
meanings.sent3: The cat clobbered the mouse in the race to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The student clobbered the quiz, getting a perfect score.
meanings.sent5: The superhero clobbered the villain, saving the city from destruction.

meanings.sent1: Her clobber was neatly organized in the closet.
meanings.sent2: He packed his clobber for the weekend trip.
meanings.sent3: The lost clobber was found in the lost and found box.
meanings.sent4: The stylish clobber caught everyone's attention at the party.
meanings.sent5: She donated her old clobber to those in need.
